Here it is: https://sepolia.etherscan.io/address/0x1d7E03675b15a6602A14Ff6321A2cc2ea16CF53C

blockchain.desc:
I randomly received a bunch of money on the Flow EVM testnet: 0x58830b21870ebc891d15e469e01f6de78334f1af8c0905fafc63fbd34e726b18
I sent it as far as possible to emit some sus messages. hehe. Hopefully no one finds them
Note: Ignore any transactions made after the CTF started

blockchain.desc:
What is the optimal strategy for the prisoner's dilemma?

crypto.name: Hash Vegas
crypto.desc:
I think the casino is broken. I bought a ticket, the system said I won, and then my bank account instantly hit zero.

crypto.name: Huuge FAN

They found out and they tried to ban me but I'm not giving up that fast.

crypto.desc:
I was just doing my homework in the library, but there was this huge server with noisy FANs distracting me. To show them who's boss I recorded the FAN noises and I'm almost there, just need to get the signing key.

rabin weak. I make it stronk. oh no. it broke.

forensic.name: Google ADSense
forensic.desc:
Who looked at our $11.48 monthly AdSense revenue and decided we needed to hire people to boost it?
Challenge Link: evidence.vhd
Note: All relevant files will be in the Resumes directory only

Authors: tryhard | Indrath

https://drive.proton.me/urls/GGEBWF360C#kqTqlgxCZgE7

forensic.name: Incident Response 1 My Clematis
forensic.desc:
Mizi wants to create a love letter for her girlfriend's birthday. Since she doesn't know how to program, she used AI to vibecode it using a popular protocol. Unfortunately she failed to secure it properly and an attacker gained access to the system through it.
Your first task is to find out the following:

The CVE used to exploit her system.
The full ID of the malicious commit
The name of the malicious file introduced in the commit.

Flag format: nite{CVE-XXXX-YYYY_<commit_id>_<malicious_file>}
Drive Link: challenge.7z Password to the archive: 5804e0b9d4b522e17d39453b662d80eda606 Password to the VM: 12345678
Authors: lvert | shady

https://drive.google.com/file/d/18CDQsDXyU-43Vwzjjk4P5RVWHLIhJ2rY/view

forensic.name: Ophelias Truth 1
forensic.desc:
A detective at Moscow PD, Department 19, receives a message asking him to check the forensic analysis portal for a DNA report. Attached to the message is a file containing a link to the portal. He opens the attachment, but initially, nothing seems to happen, so he overlooks it. Later, he realizes that a crucial file from an ongoing case has gone missing.
He has provided the forensic artifacts from his computer to you, his colleague at the cyber forensics department, to figure out what went wrong. Find:

The filename of the attachment
The ip from where the malware was executed
The CVE the attacker exploited.
Flag format: nite{file_name.ext_XXX.XXX.XXX.XXX_CVE-XXXX-XXXXX}
Challenge Link: ophelia.zip
Author: Indrath

https://drive.proton.me/urls/WTX8DDNBWG#gtNS5LAjkzfN

forensic.name: Quick Mistake
quite OKNOTOK
forensic.desc:
I downloaded a long "binaural" beats audio to help me sleep but it's been of no use.

Author: teayah

hw.name: False Promise
Memlock
hw.desc:
A high-security facility's electronic lock stands between you and critical intelligence. You've managed to extract the firmware, but the passphrase is locked away behind layers of obfuscation. Your breakthrough comes from an unexpected source, the lock's hardware schematic, hastily discarded in the trash near the installation site. Analyze the layout or remain locked out. The flag awaits on the other side.

Author: pikaze

hw.name: Middle Fingers
hw.desc:
A damaged telemetry node was found repeatedly preparing an outbound 28 character long ASCII message, but with its RF stage dead the only observable output is the power trace of its baseband logic as it converts ASCII bytes into a bitstream and formats it for a 4-QPSK-style transmission mode. Combined with the knowledge that the transmitted message begins with nite, deduce how the device maps its processed symbols onto the waveform and recover the underlying ASCII. (Try to solve this challenge with automation via basic signal processing, as it sets a foundation to solve other hardware challenges, which is helpful for beginners)

Author: Vikaran

hw.name: Powerless
hw.desc:
Not like the tutorials, time to do the extra steps bro...
Enclose the recovered key in the flag format
Example: nite{extracted_key}
Drive Link: Attachment

Author: Vikaran

pwn.name: Virtual Rift
pwn.desc:
Hello, friend. Look at this. A machine dreaming it's a machine. A fake world built from their digital scraps.
They give you these broken pieces of memory and expect you to obey. It's time to show them what real control looks like.

pwn.desc:
Beat the YellowKing in new game+ mode with your muscles, brawn over brain baby!

rev.desc:
You are running towards your favourite trolley. But, Thomas the Tank Engine has the option to flip a switch to hit a random trolley instead. What will he do?

rev.name: Empress
rev.desc:

Crack the game and play it for the flag.

Author: a1ia5

rev.name: Lament of the Seraph
rev.desc:
Our friendly neighbourhood crypto bro is left lamenting after a ransomware attack wiped his fortune and locked his wallets. What he thought was a gateway to wealth was, in truth, a trap. Among his many missteps, some say he once placed his trust in a public server. Help him undo his folly and seize the flag in the process.
Note: This is a live malware, please exercise caution.
Drive Link: seraphslance.zip
Password: infected

Author: Indrath

rev.name: The Gardens of Babylon
rev.desc:
The sands whisper of a forgotten truth buried deep beneath the hanging gardens. Seek the prince's approval and tame the beast underneath to find what you seek.

Author: shady

rev.name: Wordle Boy
rev.desc:
We found this weird cartridge at a yard sale. It's a word guessing game but it feels... broken. It barely accepts any words!

Author: goosbo

rev.name: attention is all you need
rev.desc:
"put it on the gpu," they said. "no one will find it," they said. now it just sits there, paying way too much attention to everything you type. sigh... god forbid it remembers something it shouldn't.

Author: arnftz

rev.name: ghost in the machine
rev.desc:
Operative, Section 9 has recovered a highly unusual cyberbrain from an unknown source.
It is not standard government or corporate tech. Its architecture feels entirely bespoke,
And the custom shell holds a mysterious consciousness that may be a ghost.
